headline: WOKE Arizona State University President Michael Crow Surrenders To Cancel Culture – Cancels Conservative Event Featuring Congressman Andy Biggs

The Arizona Free Enterprise Club released a statement crediting cancel culture and ASU President Michael Crow for their event’s cancellation.

AZ Free News reported,
Arizona State University (ASU) decided to cancel a prominent conservative program’s first annual fundraiser scheduled for next month, and there are conflicting explanations behind their decision.

If Michael Crow is going to surrender to the ‘cancel culture’ mob, then he is no longer fit to be ASU President and should resign.”
ASU only has one authorized ideology, which is leftism.
Woke Arizona State University President Michael Crow decided to cancel a conservative group’s event featuring Arizona Congressman Andy Biggs and former Utah Congressman Jason Chaffetz.
“It is outrageous that Michael Crow and ASU would cancel an ASU Foundation Fundraiser because they oppose the views and philosophy of the featured speakers attending the event.
The same university that allows radical leftists to discriminate against others and display “Death to America” signs won’t allow Republican Congressmen to speak on campus.
It is well known that Democrat politicians, including US Senator Kyrsten Sinema, have in the past or currently work for the University at taxpayer expense.
The event was arranged to honor prominent community leaders Dan and Carleen Brophy; 100 percent of the event proceeds were to go to the program.
